candidates.title: chore(deps): bump reqwest from 0.11.4 to 0.11.6

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

candidates.body:
Bumps [reqwest](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest) from 0.11.4 to 0.11.6.
Release notes

Sourced from reqwest's releases.

v0.11.5

  • Add ClientBuilder::http1_only() method.
  • Add tls::Version type, and ClientBuilder::min_tls_version() and ClientBuilder::max_tls_version() methods.
  • Implement TryFrom<Request> for http::Request.
  • Implement Clone for Identity.
  • Fix NO_PROXYenvironment variable parsing to more closely match curl's. Comma-separated entries are now trimmed for whitespace, and * is allowed to match everything.
  • Fix redirection to respect https_only option.
  • (wasm) Add Body::as_bytes() method.
  • (wasm) Fix sometimes wrong conversation of bytes into a JsValue.
  • (wasm) Avoid dependency on serde-serialize feature.

New Contributors 😍

  • @​blyxxyz made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#1294
  • @​Saruniks made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#1296
  • @​dlesl made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#1313
  • @​Dr-Emann made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#1322
  • @​jmgilman made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#1335
  • @​silvioprog made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#1334
  • @​skystar-p made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#1341
  • @​abatkin made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#1332
  • @​VictorBulba made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#1270
Changelog

Sourced from reqwest's changelog.

v0.11.6

  • (wasm) Fix request bodies more.

v0.11.5

  • Add ClientBuilder::http1_only() method.
  • Add tls::Version type, and ClientBuilder::min_tls_version() and ClientBuilder::max_tls_version() methods.
  • Implement TryFrom<Request> for http::Request.
  • Implement Clone for Identity.
  • Fix NO_PROXYenvironment variable parsing to more closely match curl's. Comma-separated entries are now trimmed for whitespace, and * is allowed to match everything.
  • Fix redirection to respect https_only option.
  • (wasm) Add Body::as_bytes() method.
  • (wasm) Fix sometimes wrong conversation of bytes into a JsValue.
  • (wasm) Avoid dependency on serde-serialize feature.
Commits
  • 59bc9a9 v0.11.6
  • 1365698 Update cookie_store dependency (#1268)
  • bd4e0c6 fmt: wasm body (#1359)
  • d35c311 Update async body doc (#1357)
  • bb3d102 wasm: don't send request body as plain uint8 array (#1358)
  • fead177 Fix body to JsValue conversion (#1354)
  • c9217d8 fix: wasm client: pass response header to builder by reference (#1350)
  • 597833d docs/comments: fix some typos (#1346)
  • 5cc1eff v0.11.5
  • d40276c wasm: add missing as_bytes method to Body implementation (#1270)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

candidates.title: test: add tests for fixed-hash-related crates after a minor refactor
candidates.body:
### What problem does this PR solve?

- refactor: don't have to import the specific types when construct fixed hashes with macros

  - A simplest example to explain:

    - Before this PR:
      ```rust
      use ckb_fixed_hash::{h256, H256};
      fn func () {
          let const_value = h256!("0x12345678");
      }
      ```

      _The `H256` isn't written in the code, but still have to be imported._

    - After this PR:
      ```rust
      use ckb_fixed_hash::h256;
      fn func () {
          let const_value = h256!("0x12345678");
      }
      ```
      _The `H256` will be imported in the macro automatically via `use $crate::H256;`._

- Add tests for `fixed-hash`-related crates.

### Check List

Tests

- Unit test

### Release note

```release-note
None: Exclude this PR from the release note.
```

candidates.title: test: add tests for logger-related crates after fix few negligible issues
candidates.body:
### What problem does this PR solve?

- Fix few negligible logger-related issues:

  - fix: the default logger configuration doesn't have the default values

    `toml::from_str::<LoggerConfig>("").unwrap() != LoggerConfig::default()`

  - fix: cause ambiguity since log file could be irrelevant to the `log_dir`

    For example, if a user of crate `ckb-logger-service` set `logger.log_dir="/tmp/log_dir"` and `logger.file="run.log"` but run the binary under `/tmp/workdir`, he/she could NOT find the log file in `/tmp/log_dir`, because the log file is in `/tmp/workdir`.

    Changes:
    - Let the `logger.file` to be the main log file name.
    - Written the main log into `logger.log_dir.join(logger.file)`.

  _Only internal values are changed, doesn't affect the users of `ckb`._

- Minor changes:

  - remove useless `#[derive(Debug)]`
    - Two structs are private.
    - Another two don't have public constructor methods and their instances couldn't be got after initialized.
      _p.s. Maybe these two structs should be private too._

- Add tests for logger-related crates.

### Check List

Tests

- Unit test

Side effects

- Coverage of unit tests has been increased significantly:

  |          Directory          |            Lines Coverage            |        Functions Coverage        |
  |-----------------------------|--------------------------------------|----------------------------------|
  | ckb/util/logger-config/src  | `2/15 = 13.3%` -> `24/24 = 100%`     | `5/58 = 8.6%` -> `16/65 = 24.6%` |
  | ckb/util/logger-service/src | `32/364 = 8.8%` -> `318/345 = 92.2%` | `4/48 = 8.3%` -> `35/42 = 83.3%` |

### Release note

```release-note

```
